intro: Cerastium arvense subsp. calcicola, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pink flowers throughout the summer, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes. Due to its hardy nature, it is adapted to cold climates and can tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
